keyword: how many calories in a cup of flour
title: How Many Calories in a Cup of Flour?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in a cup of flour, including carbs, protein, full nutrition facts per serving, and preparation tweaks for baking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cup of Flour?
assumptions: All-purpose white flour, unsifted (≈125 g per cup), plain with no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flour type, brand, sifting method, and density; weights can differ. Check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of all-purpose flour has about 455 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use cake flour (lighter density, ≈115 g per cup)

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of all-purpose flour?
How much protein is in a cup of flour?
faqs.a: About 12.5 g protein per cup of all-purpose flour.
Yes, mostly—around 95 g carbs per cup, with 3.4 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does flour have fat or cholesterol?
faqs.a: Very low fat (1.3 g per cup) and 0 mg cholesterol.

faqs.q: How does flour type affect calories?
faqs.a: Whole wheat is lower (~410 kcal/cup); cake flour similar but lighter weight reduces totals.
